PuppyCat was being a jerk because he's established to be a jerk. His hissy 
fit is him acting out about not getting what he wanted. He thinks he's 
above everyone else and people should cater to him.

ingredients. His sister comes over and he confesses they were missing an 
ingredient, so she excuses herself to go have a cry in the bathroom about 
how she can't afford the ingredient. Her blurting it out was entirely in 
character though. Please see the "I'M SHOVING THE CROTCH ICE UNDER THE 
DOOR" unnecessarily shouted comment she made in the original short.

main characters that lack substance. Just a personal preference.

top_comment.text:
why do people say the art quality has gone down the style just changed 
which happens in every cartoon pilot. the color palette is amazing I've 
never seen a cartoon that capture natural light especially of dawn so well 
unless it was a super budget anime and still it never really left the same 
impression as real life which here i think they did a good job . the 
details are great especially the background. they capture the whole 
ambiance of relaxed calmness with the music. the pacing was good. just 
because puppy cat was slapstick in this one doesn't mean he'll be like that 
the whole series (FYI  he was running their recipe cause Deckard called him 
cute.) this obviously wasn't a bee or puppy cat character development 
episode but Deckards. who I love the fact that the gave him a lisp I 
stumble on words just like he does. the only thing I have to complain is 
that I think that their lines are a tad bit to soft so the animation errors 
are more obvious but it goes well with the overall design i guess they were 
willing to make sacrifices also bee was a tad bit too childish but I feel 
like that her development will be kind of coming of age where its about her 
becoming an adult final thing bee does now have a job she's just lying 
about being unemployed how could anyone explain being an intergalactic temp 
agent thats how she was able to refurbish her apartment  ﻿

seemed, less interesting as a whole. Puppycat has been reduced to one 
character trait and the plot for this episode was not interesting enough 
for an opening episode.

all is said and done.﻿

my adult life and only fluctuate between the high and low end of being 
"overweight" since I moved from America, I have gotten down to a normal 
weight only for a short time after a year living in a country where I ate 
only one small meal a day and had to walk several miles every day to get 
anywhere and that was gone within three months of resuming living in the 
U.S.

acknowledge the label.

above being incredibly thin.
